page.title: 15Kirkconnel:Children's Games
page.content: Our inquiries show that few of the traditional street games are played. The seasonal playing of marbles (bools),the usual hide 'n seek and chasing seem to have survived. A game called Hunts is perhaps a variation on an older game. Two teams take part. The hunted run to hide. The Hunters give chase and when they catch their prey he/she is taken to the den from which he/she may be rescued. Kick the Can is a variation of Hide'n Seek and involves the 'sought' trying to return to the den before being caught, and kicking a can placed there thus showing that he has returned and freeing anyone who may have been caught. Perhaps television is responsible for this situation or the level of sophistication of modern-day toys.
